website_summaries.verdict: While people liked the New Balance Fresh Foam Arishi v2 for what it had to offer, more than a few of them weren’t happy with some of its parts. While the lightweight construction was praised, the midsole was criticized for being unsupportive of the tendons and muscles of the underfoot. In fact, most of the complaints were about the cushioning unit as it was apparently flimsy compared to other Fresh Foam models. But the flexibility and the general durability of this road companion were highlighted as effective aspects.
pros: The general durability of the Fresh Foam Arishi v2 was welcomed
people didn’t experience any material breakdown or separation
The various color schemes that were available were lauded because they made the shoe pop visually
Purchasers were happy with the breathable upper, stating that it kept the foot as dry and ventilated as possible
The flexibility of this running shoe was appreciated
testers noted that they were able to quickly transition through the gait without any hindrances
The light construction of this product gained praise as it didn’t cause the runners to feel as if their movements were marred or limited
cons: Some consumers stated that the Fresh Foam unit in the midsole of the Arishi v2 wasn’t as responsive or full-bodied as the ones in other shoes that feature the tech
Several testers lamented the lack of an arch support mechanism
they felt that the flat surface of the midsole didn’t offer much comfort or steadiness to the foot-pad

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: HATE IT!  Comfortable to wear, but annoying to put on.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The worst shoes I've ever bought. I've never hated shoes so much. Only six months and there's a hole in them already, very cheap material, insole keeps moving, laces keep coming untied....just terrible. Very lightweight and comfortables shoe, just what I expected from New Balance. However,this shoe has THE flimsiest tongue I have ever seen in a shoe. It's beyond annoying! Every time you stick your foot in the shoe, the tongue shoots straight back into the toe box. You pretty much have to sit down or bend over to put your shoes on every time. I'm very disappointed, and will not be buying this shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: ilab326

customer_reviews.title: Sole peeling off after only 2 days!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 days, the sole has already started peeling off the shoe. Terrible quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Lake

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfy.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing these for 2 weeks now. They’re pretty comfortable and light. The only minor flaw is the tongue doesn’t stay in place. It keeps twisting to the side. Other than that the shoes have been great.
customer_reviews.author: K t

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well to the looser side. My size is 13 4E so having them a tad loose doesn't bother me. These are a great shoe for every day & for working out. Good value & arrived early. Highly recommend these unless you have narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy from this seller. These ARE NOT real New Balance shoes
customer_reviews.text: Hate these shoes. I love New Balance but ordered these big and still tight. Very little arch support and nowhere near the foam padding that they put in their shoes. Feel like i bought N.B. and got a knockoff brand. Amazon should be ashamed of themselves for letting this happen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Thin, cheap material
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage! I am stunned that New Balance offers a shoe of such low quality! Tongue of shoe is as thin as cardboard, no padding, no padding around the ankles either. I was trying to find a shoe to replace one of the old Vazee Rush styles that I absolutely love.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Nice color for a sneaker. But as has been previously noted, the tongue of the sneaker is paper thin. While walking around in my own home, the inside of the sneaker was rough, as though I’d been walking on tiny pebbles. Not comfortable, not cushiony, and feels flimsy all around. I join other reviewers: New Balance ain’t what it used to be, and that’s a pity.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room in the tow box without the ankle being too wide. I ordered a half size up so I could still use my inserts and have plenty of wiggle room.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Nice show, but too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy only NB for years because I have a wide foot (4EE). They were the only shoe that came in widths that I could find back then. A huge plus, too, was they were made in the USA. The label of the last NB shoe I looked did not say Made in USA. This shoe was too snug.
customer_reviews.author: V. Strother

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, but needs some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my regular size in the wide format because I wanted extra room in the toe box. And this choice worked well for my average width feet. The shoes are light and reasonably flexible. However, the soles were a bit thin. It was only after inserting some aftermarket gel insoles did the bottom of my feet feel comfortable. Another tweak was to replace the existing laces with stretch laces. This made a big difference in the comfort across the top of the foot. After these adjustment, these shoes are working really well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a women's size 8.5-9 sneaker in extra wide width, and often order men's shoes, especially New Balance, to get the width I need. This was available in men's size 7, 4E width in the soft green color for a very low price, so I jumped on it. I'm not a runner, just bought it for general wear and walking. It fits adequately and is roomy enough to wear with a thin sock, but considering it is supposed to be a 4E, has no width or room in the toe box to spare. The upper doesn't give or breathe particularly well either. All in all it is a decent shoe that is attractive and serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: La Bonita

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight running shoe. Wore them straight out of the box walking several miles a day around DC and no issues. Only complaint - if you have high arches like me, you might want to throw in some insoles as there is little arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Farthing

customer_reviews.title: Extra wide is perfect for extra wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I found these shoes! I have very wide feet normally, so when I got pregnant and my feet started to swell finding any shoes that my feet fit in, was incredibly difficult. These shoes solve that problem, and a comfortable on top of that. I did immediately put a half insole in, as my heel is narrow and short, but can still say the shoes are very comfortable. I have been wearing them for almost 3 months now whenever I go anywhere and they are holding up great. Definitely a must have for pregnancy if you have already wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, defective sample.
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of this shoe in different colors. Really like them. Fit great, true to size, comfortable and light weight. Wear is average. This pair was terrible. Shape was off, curved to the inside. Cut very small and narrow. Perhaps they were mislabeled. No way of telling but completely different than my other two pairs. On top of this, it was clear this pair had been returned. The left shoe was untied and the paper stuffer was lose in the box. My guess is the previous buyer had a similar experience to mine and returned them. If you buy a 10.5 4E check them carefully.
customer_reviews.author: zakeman

customer_reviews.title: I thought I liked new balance...... until......
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying new balance running shoes for about 5 years. Overall really good shoes and have been able to put good miles on each pair. This most recent pair was a different story. After a little more than 3 months of use, running about 12 miles a week both shoes ripped on the outside edge of the shoe on the same day. Never had this problem before. Do I have a wide foot? Yes. 4E width is all I buy but again never had a problem until now. I’m questioning the quality the shoes. Not here to bash the New Balance brand I’ll probably buy another pair of New Balances shortly but I won’t buy this pair again.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Hill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and wide
customer_reviews.text: These type/brand of shoe in this style is my third pair I've ordered. I have a large/wide (4E) foot for a woman, and these in a 9.5 men's do not make my foot look huge. They are comfortable and hold up well to my weight. I have ordered another pair because I am expecting a lot for the price (very reasonable), and because of the wear like to have several to switch out with. If you have a wide foot, I recommend these. I feel like my foot is supportive without being "stuffed" into the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: "Lifestyle" shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are "lifestyle" shoes, not running shoes. They're decent looking, relatively inexpensive, have moderate cushioning. I definitely wouldn't want to run in these. I did not have the tongue issue others have mentioned, but they do make an annoying rubbing farting noise when I walk. These probably should be $30, not $50.
customer_reviews.author: AAAAmazon Customerrrrr

customer_reviews.title: Did I buy a knockoff?
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst pair of New Balance shoe I've ever owned. This is also my first time ordering a shoe through the mail. Usually NB shoes are comfortable and wide. This shoe is not. It's not as wide as it should be and how i buy it. The sole is just 1 thin layer of cushion. I wear this shoe all day for walking around. My feet is in pain by noon. I bought this in feb along with other pairs of shoes and now it's June. Pulled it out to use it and man, pretty disappointed. I'd give it zero stars if i could because i've bough NB shoes all my life and it's not this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Xua Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for 30 bucks
customer_reviews.text: If they ever went for sale again at this price i'd probably snag another pair. They're lightweight and comfortable, they have flaws however. The insert doesn't fit inside one of the shoes and needs constant adjustment, and the front of the shoe has some kind of cheap plastic holding the toe up that quickly deforms after use. I don't expect these to last long but for what they provide I'm ok with it, as long as they keep the price low I'm happy. These are not worth a dime over 30 bucks imo.
customer_reviews.author: Sauce

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little bit difficult for me to find the right shoe because I have flat feet and use special orthotics. I’m on my feet most of the day and also do a lot of walking and hiking. I used to run a lot and learned that one of the best walking shoe is it running shoe. Although I have heard others recommend not to use a running shoe for walking, I found this to be ideal shoe for me. Just ordered my second pair. Insoles are removable if you have to put in orthotics. Light and very comfortable, good traction.
customer_reviews.author: Uri Shinsky

customer_reviews.title: A CHEAP sneaker that's actually GREAT???
customer_reviews.text: Not going to complain when I paid $28.20 for the pair. I should've bought 2 pairs and also gotten a 1/2 size larger "11" if you MUST know, but here again I won't complain. I'm not hard on these shoes. I use them strictly for the gym and all I do is "lift weights up and put them down!!!" and walk from station to station. Pretty basic... I know, right? It's been a week and they're holding up... Praise Jesus! On a serious note... I got basic sneakers to do a basic job at a great price. I hope you enjoy yours as I do mine. "Yeah baby!!!" Time to run!!
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Sexy for those with wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I have always had trouble buying shoes because of my wide feet and have had to resort towards really clunky ugly shoes that make me look like I’m in engineering school (I am). But these beauties came and made my feet look normal for the first time in my life. I was so jealous of everyone wearing vans and converse and looking fresh, now I join them. These shoes are not the best support but I’m young and healthy I don’t need that. Plus they’re 50 dollars, come on. They are SO light and breathable perfect for my hot climate. LOVE the all black it goes with everything. Fits like a glove. The laces are strong they stay tied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for High Mileage Distance Runners
customer_reviews.text: For my weight and size I normally easily get 400-500 miles out of my average running shoes. I'm 5'10 and weight 170 lbs and a long distance runner, averaging 7-15 miles a day. These shoes felt great straight out of the box but 150-200 miles the padding and support was gone. I've tried two pair of them and they both are the same... as with most of my retired running shoes, they look basically almost new but there is zero padding and support left in the shoe and they have 150 miles each on them.
customer_reviews.author: GWF

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Fit! And a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I think one thing I like about my feet is that they are wide. And I can always find wide shoes for cheap. That's the case here. I got mine for a very reasonable price on sale. I've always loved New Balance for making wider shoes in the first place, but these extra wide walking shoes are great. That's why I always go back to NB. They are not made as solid as before as these fabrics do tend to tear, make a hole on the big toe side, usually. But these fit great (size fit as expected), and breathes well.
customer_reviews.author: jobae

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of New Balance golf shoes a few months ago and I love the quality and comfort. So this shoe looks identical in the pictures. It's not. Thin fabric, hard sole and cheesy tongue make this the first and last time I buy a shoe online. The shoe is hard to get on since the tongue is so flacid it's in the way and moves around after the shoe is tied. I give it two stars since it does look good. Next shoe I buy will be in a store.
customer_reviews.author: J Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Runs Narrow, Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Shoe run narrow. Tongue is narrow leading to exposed sock. I don't know what's up with NB but every shoe I have tried in the last couple months has ran narrow. I have worn NB for many years and I've been trying to find a pair of shoes. I wear 4E and up to now have never had a problem finding NB shoes that fit. I have ordered and returned 10 different styles and they were all too narrow even though they are advertised as true to size. Being disappointed with NB I've ordered a pair of Under Armor to try out.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Too firm.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed was how nice they seemed to fit. Then... Ugh. Blister town. Usually my experience is that blisters happen when the shoe doesn't fit. Here, the shoe fit perfectly, but the arch support felt out of place and the rest of the cushioning felt too hard. I do see that a lot of people have good things to say about the Arishi v2. That's actually why I gave it a try. Unfortunately I just find them unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: Norm David G.

customer_reviews.title: only lacks cushion
customer_reviews.text: They fit well, are lightweight, breathable outer, look nice, but was surprised there's almost no cushion in the sole. Running on the treadmill is fine, but it's not great for running on the street/sidewalk.
customer_reviews.author: inkedzeus

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent shoe for the money. I have a wide foot and they are a little snug but they will stretch enough. They are well made and comfortable to work around in. I would not recommend these for running on street for distances over a mile or so maybe 2 or 3 times a week. I feel the cushion is thin and too hard, for me anyway. For further distancess and more frequent training I recommend a different shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable but not well made
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. Build quality is substantially less than I'd expect from New Balance. I recommend the shoes for comfort - they are great for walking about three miles per day - but buy them at the lowest possible price - try to find them for under forty dollars. Do NOT pay seventy or more dollars for these shoes or you will be disappointed when you need new ones in three months.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Pretty garbage shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar style of New Balance foam shoes before and loved them. They lasted much longer than this version. These shoes had holes in them within a few months. The tongues never stays straight and always moves off to the side when I wear them. They are comfortable but not as comfortable as the previous pair. They just seem very cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: miketmartin

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was comfortable and they fit as expected. I am a woman who wears a size 8 to 8 and 1/2 shoe. In this particular issue I ordered a 7 and it was a men's shoe and because of the material in which it was made of, I gave myself some room as I was also adding an insole for extra support on my right foot. Has she worked out perfectly. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kenyatta J Strait

customer_reviews.title: Well made sturdy shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made shoe. It’s sturdy without being heavy. The laces are crisp and the seams well finished. The touted Fresh Foam midsole is harder than I thought. I was expecting a more cushiony shoe. It’s not bad but I wouldn’t expect to feel like you’re floating on clouds. The shoe looks as good as the photo. I would buy again and would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Should come with a better fitting insole and wider, stable tongue for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Shoes look awesome but the insole is very thin. Within 1 week I noticed the insole would squeak due to how thin it was. I also noticed the tongue tends to move a lot and can sometimes reveal your socks underneath. Without socks or boat shoe socks on the tongue is just all over the place; highly annoying. I moved from Nike to NB because the insoles and materials lasted longer. Now it seems NB is going the Nike route.
customer_reviews.author: itr81

customer_reviews.title: Nice flexible shoe, but not much support
customer_reviews.text: Good, wide fit. Not much support/cushion. Would not recommend for running or jogging. They work just fine for walking and running errands. Best thing about them is the look of the shoe and the flexibility. Also, as others have mentioned the tongue will easily move to the side. So if that’s a deal breaker don’t buy this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, look great, a tiny bit more narrow than I'm accustomed to with New Balance.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look good, are well assembled and are very comfortable. The only thing that's a tiny bit unexpected is that they're a tiny bit narrower than the typical New Balance I've owned. I was able to compensate for this perfectly by loosening the lacing, otherwise I may have wished to choose a wide in the same size.
customer_reviews.author: THATCHMAN1

customer_reviews.title: OK shoe, my fault for expecting more
customer_reviews.text: My first try buying shoes on-line. For me, not best way for a new shoe. perhaps with a shoe already familiar. I was expecting too much. The shoe received is fair priced for what it is, but I want a better shoe. I purchased during Amazon sale days. Basic shoe. Seems medium comfortable. Shoe collar around heel is thin, I am worried about side rip-out does not appear to be reinforced laterally. I simply want a better shoe, more comfort, better arch support, better design for endurance wear. Returning these.
customer_reviews.author: S. Churan

customer_reviews.title: Good walking or casual shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price to value. However these aren't running shoes. You could run in these but I wouldn't recommend it. I bought them for casual use. These also aren't as comfortable as the higher end fresh foam running shoes (which I also own). These are great for walking and casual usage. As other reviews state, the tongue of the shoe and heel aren't as sturdy as their high end running shoes so you have to untie them to get in and out. On the upside of that, this makes the shoe a bit more sleek. So rating this based on it being a walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Arman Long

customer_reviews.title: Amazon ships in a bag on shoes...
customer_reviews.text: Well got the shoes in today. First off though before unboxing, Amazon put them in a bag instead of a box to ship and it crushed in the front of the shoe box. However, looking/wearing the shoes they are light and feel nice... one comment if you wear your shoes tight might feel some discomfort around the ankles. At the moment though I like them minus the whole crushing my package thing.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes°
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are quality built and very very comfortable! If you have wide feet, look no further than New Balance!! They always provide the best support while being adequately wide!
customer_reviews.author: firemedic2008

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet = more fun running
customer_reviews.text: I have duck feet - 4E wide forefoot, narrow heel. Usually (in other shoes), by the time I am 3+ miles into a run, I start feeling a little bit of a sore spot on the inside edge of the ball of my foot and big toe from rubbing the sole of the shoe (even 4E wide shoes). Just went for my first run in these this morning and ran over 4 miles because my feet feel GREAT. Great fit for a stupid wide forefoot and narrow heel. Definitely ordering more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: If you're rugged on a shoe you might want to get a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe isn't New balances flag ship by any means. It's still not a bad shoe. It's more of the low end sedan. It will get you from point A to point B. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves them
customer_reviews.text: He likes that they are lightweight and breathable. He also enjoys that they are comfortable as well. great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Zia Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st time getting XW so it's a bit large but besides that the foam is very soft and comfortable. I've always liked New Balance's shoes but not sure if it's the XW or what but the shoes' shape isn't as nice as the picture. Will definitely buy from New Balance again but probably not XW next time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Siu

customer_reviews.title: Most uncomfortable New Balance I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've owned New Balance shoes for at least 20 years and this is the most uncomfortable I have ever owned. They look great but that's all. So far the show is durable to normal wear which is what I expect from a great company like New Balance but be prepared to replace the insole as it provides zero comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Lacking in Archery?
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is alright. Im sure some like the style, but for someone who works in a concrete floor evironment i cant recommend. Not enough support. Which is disappointing considering i never had a NB shoe i didnt like. Shoe walks kinda flat honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Rockdpm

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Design or Shoddy Manufactuing??
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September and 2 months later the shoes are falling apart! I love supporting New Balance which has a local presence in Boston but this is shoddy. Either shoddy design or shoddy manufacturing. A sneaker should last more than 2 months with normal usuage.
customer_reviews.author: squeaks1111

customer_reviews.title: No Support or comfort at all.Walmart 10 dollar sneakers are better.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the all black which looks nice but if you like to walk on concrete all day you may as well go barefoot. There is a paper thin sole insert. If you buy a gel insert you might like them. Also the tongue is so tiny my socks are showing most of the time. Very light weight and cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: john wilson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Good: Very comfortable. Very light. Keep the feet nice and cool in summer. Fairly inexpensive. Mediocre: The tread started wearing off significantly within 3 months and there wasn't much there to begin with. I was hoping to get 6 months out of these. I walk about 15-20k a week.
customer_reviews.author: Peridot Antlers

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not very supportive. Developed foot pain (plantar fasciitis) within two weeks running 40-50mi a week. I switched to my old shoes and have had no problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: GOOD LOOKING
customer_reviews.text: SHOE WAS A LITTLE TIGHT BUT WEARABLE,WOULD HAVE SENT BACK BUT I WOULD HAVE TO PAY SHIPPING BECAUSE IT WAS SOLD BY AMAZON CONTRACTOR, NEVER AGAIN IF ITS NOT SOLD BY AMAZON I DONT BUY !!!
customer_reviews.author: TJW

customer_reviews.title: A bad running or walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: In a few words... 1 poor quality. The sole wore out after eight weeks of use, or around a hundred miles of*walking*. This is my second Arishi, the first developed a hole in the fabric near the toe after just six months of use. 2. Poor shock absorption.. I used to have a lot of pain in my heel and my foot after walks
customer_reviews.author: minimalist

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected for shoe size.
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes primarily for gym workouts. Plenty of cushioning yet lightweight. They are very comfortable for walking and occasionally casual running. Very satisfied, thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 10.5 extra wide. The shoe was in small side. Fits in length but puts pressure over big toe.
customer_reviews.author: Revil

customer_reviews.title: A little larger than most brands.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, which is great for running. However the shoe does run about a half size bigger than other brands I have bought. This may be because the shoe is wide without Amazon listing them as a wide size.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoe for comfort and light exercise
customer_reviews.text: High quality finish details. Typical craftmanship from New Balance. Easy to slip on and comfortable for around the house or taking the dog for a walk. Excellent arch support.
customer_reviews.author: JCooJr

customer_reviews.title: All around great shoe and great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to replace an old pair of Asics I have had. My main purpose for these shoes were for walking, daily commute and use at work. I like that they are very comfortable, breathable and fit perfectly! I also like the neutral grey color because it matches almost all my clothes. I know someone people have complained about the inner tongue slipping to the side when the shoes are tied. It does happen slightly, but it's not a big deal in my opinion. I love these shoes and highly recommend if need some fashionable, multipurpose shoes!
customer_reviews.author: David Capelo

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable for walking or jogging if you do not need a lot of heel cushioning or support. Incredibly light weight and flexible. The best I had in these categories.
customer_reviews.author: The bike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoes. But odd material tongue.  😝😝
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are very comfortable and fit well. The only thing is the tongue of the shoes is just a piece of leather with no padding. Maybe I dont know anything about running and this is normal. Other than that the shoes are very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Nicole Lane

customer_reviews.title: Could be wider like ASICS' wide widths, but still great
customer_reviews.text: The NB wides are always a bit narrower than the ASICS of similar sizes, but oh well. NB's color select for wides are much better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It won't take long to get these broken in, they're extremely comfortable, fit well, these are just another reason why I don't buy any other shoes but New Balance, quality of shoe's are great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gove

customer_reviews.title: Decent, light shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes for walking. They are really light and comfortable. They don't last super long(~1 year) but for the price range it's an decent value. I would recommend for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Flack

customer_reviews.title: if walk all day GET THEM
customer_reviews.text: had them for a week super dry feet after 7 day 10 hr shifts.I walk about 4 miles at work,so pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Mata

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with these shoes, I've been having problems with other shoes rubbing blisters from being too narrow or having rubber on them that would rub. But so far there's no problems with these shoes 😁
customer_reviews.author: Rnrsteff

customer_reviews.title: One down side
customer_reviews.text: The tongue of this particular model slides to one side or the other without fail every time when out for a run. I Love new balance always, just rhis model had a small flaw in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Haye

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Not an expensive shoe, but fits well. The insoles have very little support, but fortunately replacing is an easy fix. The tongue will not stay aligned and slides over to one side, even with the strings through the loop. Overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: D. Spain

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoes unfortunately it is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered a 10 extra wide but for some reason it is not wide enough. Never had this problem with New Balance shoes. Hopefully wearing it more would make this shoe wider. I hope!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Lam

customer_reviews.title: Good color design may be ok for running but long hours walk work standing not good.
customer_reviews.text: best color design available in the market. I wish they could design the same color style in daily wearing regular design soft padding as I have pain issues for long hours work standing or walk. May be good for running but long hours in this shoes doesn’t feel good. After a while feet will start having pain and feel tired.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Light and fits
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t expect these shoes to fit so well! I never order shoes I always have to try them on. These fit perfect straight out of the box! Feel great on the feet!
customer_reviews.author: bill spitzer

customer_reviews.title: no!
customer_reviews.text: NO that is not ozone blue---I'm half a$$ color blind especially blues, gray, green colors. But against the red box I could tell that wasn't BLUE ask my girl friend she said nice turquoise shoes buddy :-/ TURQUOISE what the what I bought them for casual wear and comfort they are just ok and the color limits them all together!!!
customer_reviews.author: Redwood

customer_reviews.title: Good looking pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t notice at the time of buying that’s most of shoe is made out of clothing material and I don’t think they last a long . Fitted as expected
customer_reviews.author: NKSalimov

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Just picked up seriously running since the whole COVID thing and gyms closing down. These are comfortable and perfect for long runs. They fit VERY well and have helped with some issues i've had with other shoes - tight hamstrings, calves and back. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and Breathable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect because this was my first time buying shoes online. I'm a big guy with 4E wide needs for shoes. These were absolutely fantastic since I first put them on and I use them every day for the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Murtland

customer_reviews.title: Super light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My most comfortable shoes. I wear them as golf shoes, they are great. Not waterproof though so if you're playing golf in the rain you I need to wear something else.😄
customer_reviews.author: Noely

customer_reviews.title: Infamous shoe tongue that moves while you run.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are fine. They're not the greatest in breathable. I'm not of fan of having hot sweaty feet. Also, there is a manufacturer defect (See red circle). I didn't feel it when running only when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I ordered these for work which is delivery. I'm off and on my feet, in and out the truck, up and down steps, sidewalks, and gravel constantly. They are light weight and comfortable. My feet aren't hurting or tired when I get home so perfect! They aren't very sturdy so you have to watch out for snags and stay out of the mud lol. I've had them a couple months and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Well Being

customer_reviews.title: They're no WCB's
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, one of the patch/sticker things on the tongue was loose. Tried to just be real careful, but sure enough it came off a couple months later. The shoes are also pretty narrow and the tongues constantly migrate toward the outer side of the shoe. Maybe I just need to shell out the cash for some reliable white crispy bois...
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Thaler

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't be beat. Looks great. Lightweight as it seems. Not too supportive (like the 990, but didn't expect it to be). Great lightweight shoe for casual wear. For my needs, I wouldn't use it for long walks--that's what my 990's are for.
customer_reviews.author: cq

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Size Sent
customer_reviews.text: When you need a 13W, a 13M will not suffice! Looking at the 13M, I could tell this shoe runs very narrow anyway. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: SanDiegoBert

customer_reviews.title: Comfort.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are fine, just wish I didn't have such big feet, but hey, they work. When my dad was alive, he would say; "Wow, do a set of oars come with those shoes."
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dungate

customer_reviews.title: Fit great and are very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a NB wearer since 1984 and is the only brand of running/training shoe I will wear. This was my first time with this model and I am so glad that I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't care for the shoe
customer_reviews.text: The tongue is one limp piece of material. It had to be straightened out every time you put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Tim J Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Hole in top after 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: The netting developed a hole in the top after 4 months. They also are the hardest shoe to put on known to man.
customer_reviews.author: chris stalbaum

customer_reviews.title: Great casual shoe, poor running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: The fit of these shoes is good. They are comfortable and look good. The only negative I have on them is the cushioning. For a running shoe there is very little cushion. As a casual shoe or for just walking around they perform great. They just shouldn't be used for a dedicated running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: k w

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials!
customer_reviews.text: The material used on the uppers of these are extremely cheap and poorly made. A hole developed on one of the shoes within a couple of weeks. I don't recommend these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Columbus Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Little tight but fit amazing and look great
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes I bought them for casual wear and for running and my feet are a little wide so it’s a little tight but I bought elastic laces and it feels great and they look fantastic highly recommended these shoes and lock laces with them
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable but not as much support at typical New Balance. Extremely lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and right
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I have owned. I haven't had them for very long, so I can't say anything about durability. The comfort and fit however are excellent. Just the right balance of cushion and ground feel. Very light shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Attorix

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I like it I hope this shoes help me a little with the problem in my back. But I like, feel comfortable. Thank so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and comfortable, but they have absolutely no grip so be careful in the rain or snow/ice.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, stylish and light sneaker
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, stylish and light sneaker, but lacks traction on wet surfaces
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoes, fit great. They are super light as well--so if using them for exercise of any kind, they won't hold you down. Have not had them long enough to know about durability, but so long as you aren't doing some manual labor in them, no worries
customer_reviews.author: RWKarel

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected, awesome New Balance quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and upholds the New Balance product reputation. Love the lime green!
customer_reviews.author: Wiseguy

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoes for my wide feet!
customer_reviews.text: Love my NB's! These are light, breathable, and very comfy! They look sharp (I got the red bottoms). The tongue does slide around a bit, but it's not a deal breaker!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Crawford

customer_reviews.title: bad experience
customer_reviews.text: first time to wear from new balance and I shocked it's not comfort at all the size is bigger than the size chart and the left pair is more bigger than the right one there is no any kind of fresh foam as they said. i always wear from Nike and i will never buy from New Balnace anymore this the first and last time to buy this un profissonal brand.
customer_reviews.author: Moataz Adel

customer_reviews.title: Heel cup tears easy
customer_reviews.text: They’re very light, but tend to be really slippery on wet surfaces and my materials feel cheap. Fit is decent for the price. Also my heel cup is ripping and it’s only been about a month and a half Pros: -good fit and somewhat comfortable -very very light Cons: -the heel cup tears easy -doesn’t like wet surfaces -cheap materials
customer_reviews.author: Braydan

customer_reviews.title: Wide feet with insoles
customer_reviews.text: I have very wide feet and I wear insoles to correct my feet. The bottom of the tongue where it is glued started to cut into my foot to the point I had to stop wearing them. There was no way to adjust it out of the way. This is probably only an issue for people with larger feet but I had to remove the insoles. Now I use these for slipping on and off to run outside to the mailbox or takeout the trash
customer_reviews.author: Bryan McCormick

customer_reviews.title: A Bit TIght
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my usual size (9.5 4E) but these run a bit tighter than the Arishi V1's. The pair I received will break in eventually, but it's something to watch out for when ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Albert F.

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 12. These are much smaller. There's also a large return fee so now I'm stuck waiting until someone I know can grow into them.
customer_reviews.author: Rogers’

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend has had a major surgery on his foot and requires really comfortable and wide shoes. These really fit him well and alleviate the pain he typically endures daily.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Alexander

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's Arishi V2 Fresh Foam Running Shoe
product_meta.description: The New Balance Fresh Foam Arishi v2 men's shoe features a breathable upper atop signature midsole technology. This do-anything shoe features an NB Response insert for all-day comfort and style.
feature_bullets: Fresh Foam innovative midsole created from a single piece of foam that provides a plush, more natural ride
